name: Dominic Wilken
bio: During a growing conflict between major powers, Dominic was helpless to stop the destruction of his village. He volunteered for a secretive project to help end the war, one way or another. For this experiment, his memory was wiped and his body was infused with the power of The Void. Unable to speak and going by the name Umbra, he underwent many experiments in an attempt to control his void, but it kept lashing out around him. At some point he broke free and caused a massacre. After his recapture, he was exposed to The Universal Clock. Ever since then, he has heard the ticking of The Universal Clock. It calmed the void inside of him and gave him insight into the true nature of the world; he can sense the vibrations of the universe and follows the will of The Universal Clock in fighting 'elegant malevolence, sequestered in the resonance'. Part of this was realizing the mistake it was to try and control The Void, and as such he went around and killed everyone who was involved in the project.
body: Dominic is a fairly tall humanoid made of a very dark purple, almost black substance. He has light purple eyes and can tear the front of his face open to reveal a mouth full of sharp spikes. He is essentially formless, but he concentrates his mass into a humanoid shape of lighter purple, oily void, with a shell of dense, solid void. When in great distress, or unconscious for over 10 hours, his shape becomes less solid and more whispy, like smoke.
appearance: Using his Watch of the Void, he appears as a human with fair copper skin, short brown hair and yellow eyes. His blood looks red until it is far enough away from his body. His type is hidden from divination magic.

feats.name: Actor
feats.description: You have advantage on Charisma (Deception) and Charisma (Performance) checks when trying to pass yourself off as a different person. You can mimic the speech of another person or the sounds made by other creatures. You must have heard the person speaking, or heard the creature make the sound, for at least 1 minute. A successful Wisdom (Insight) check contested by your Charisma (Deception) check allows a listener to determine that the effect is faked.

feats.name: Telekinetic
feats.description: As a bonus action, you can try to telekinetically shove one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. When you do so, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + the ability modifier of the score increased by this feat) or be moved 5 feet toward you or away from you. A creature can willingly fail this save.

effects.name: Manifestation of Order
effects.description: The ticking of The Universal Clock can be heard by you and those affected by your magic.

effects.name: Restore Balance
effects.description: When a creature you can see within 60 feet is about to roll with advantage or disadvantage, you can use your reaction to prevent the roll from having advantage or disadvantage.

effects.name: Bardic Inspiration
effects.description: You can inspire others through stirring words or music. To do so, you use a bonus action on your turn to choose one creature other than yourself within 60 feet of you who can hear you. That creature gains one Bardic Inspiration die, a d6. Once within the next 10 minutes, the creature can roll the die and add the number rolled to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw it makes. The creature can wait until after it rolls the d20 before deciding to use the Bardic Inspiration die, but must decide before the DM says whether the roll succeeds or fails. A creature can have only one Bardic Inspiration die at a time. A creature regains its Bardic Inspiration die when it finishes a long rest.

magic items.name: Watch of the Void
magic items.description: The watch is attached to a silver necklace and is ornated with cog symbols. The watch never moves, but every time someone looks at it, it shows a different time. If dispelled, it will move to the correct time and start ticking at a volume suggesting it is a much bigger clockwork device, and it will become incredibly heavy.
magic items.effect: While wearing this item, spells and magical effects used to determine your creature type reveal that you are a humanoid, and you are under a permanent disguise self effect.

Frostbite.effect: 1d6 cold damage, disadvantage on next weapon attack

Vicious Mockery.effect: 1d4 psychic damage, disadvantage on next weapon attack

Dissonant Whispers.effect: 3d6 psychic damage, must use reaction to move away, save halves

Heroism.effect: gain 7 temp HP at start of turn, immune to frightened

Protection from Evil and Good.effect: immune to charm, frightened, possessed, disadvantage on attacks from abberations, celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead

Ray of Sickness.effect: 2d8 poison damage, CON save or poisoned until end of your next turn (disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks)

Shield.effect: +5 AC until start of next turn

Silvery Barbs.effect: reroll, different creature has advantage on next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw

Tasha's Hideous Laughter.effect: target falls prone, incapacitated, and unable to stand up for duration, save at end of turn or when taking damage

Aid.effect: 3 creatures gain 5 current and max HP

Invisibility.effect: target is invisible until they attack or cast a spell

Lesser Restoration.effect: end one disease or condition (blinded, deafened, paralyzed, poisoned)

Tasha's Mind Whip.effect: 3d6 psychic damage, half damage and no additional effect on save, loses reaction, next turn move, action, or bonus action

Clairvoyance.effect: create invisible sensor, see or hear through it, action switches

Haste.effect: double speed, +2 AC, advantage on DEX saves, additional action to attack, dash, disengage, hide, or use object. Can't do anything until end of their next turn when spell ends.

metamagic.name: Subtle Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell, you can spend 1 sorcery point to cast it without any somatic or verbal components.

metamagic.name: Twinned Spell
metamagic.description: When you cast a spell that targets only one creature and doesn't have a range of self, you can spend a number of sorcery points equal to the spell's level to target a second creature in range with the same spell (1 sorcery point if the spell is a cantrip).

inventory.name: Health Potion
inventory.description: A potion that restores 2d4 + 2 hit points.

quotes: [You killed someone? Why?] Does it really matter why? They are still dead because of me, and I'm still alive. Any reasons or justifications for doing so would only be for my emotional benefit. They are still dead. The damage done by the act will not change.

Just humor me for once with your new pacifistic outlook on life; imagine there's a young man with ideals like yours. Then, there is a war. All the young man's friends are fighting. His family, his brothers, are fighting. But he is not. He doesn't want to kill anyone. His brothers are fighting, and they are losing. But he still doesn't fight. They die. They all die.
If he had fought, he could have saved them. But he did not. In trying to hurt no one, everyone suffered. Do you understand? Sometimes you have no choice.

[Poor guy.] Why? He got the people he loved killed. How is it not his fault? He could have done something, and he didn't. How are those deaths not a direct result of his inaction? [It's not his fault.] It IS my fault! It HAS to be!!
events: Pretended to be an ally of Ott Steeltoes, until he revealed a secret entrance to the Xanathar hideout. Nesfits then stabbed him in the back and we dragged him out of the sewers.
Abducted Zorbog and eventually gave him to Zardos Zord.
